t: Jeremiah 6
Threatened Siege of Jerusalem
“Run*pn for cover out*ln of Jerusalem, Benjaminites. Sound*ln the ram’s horn in Tekoa; raise*ln a smoke signal over Beth-haccherem, for*ln disaster threatens from the north, even*ln a crushing blow.
Though*ln she is beautiful and delicate, I*ln will destroy Daughter Zion.
Shepherds*ln and their flocks will come against her; they*ln will pitch their tents all around her. Each*ln will pasture his own portion.
Set*ln them apart for war against her; rise*ln up, let’s attack at noon. Woe*ln to us, for the day is passing; the*ln evening shadows grow long.
Rise*ln up, let’s attack by night. Let’s*ln destroy her fortresses.”
For*p this is what the Lord*s of Armies says: Cut*pn down the trees; raise*ln a siege ramp against Jerusalem. This*ln city must be punished. There*ln is nothing but oppression within her.
As*ln a well gushes out its water, so*ln she pours out her evil. Violence*ln and destruction resound in her. Sickness*ln and wounds keep coming to my attention.
Be*ln warned, Jerusalem, or*ln I will turn away from you; I*ln will make you a desolation, a*ln land without inhabitants.
Wrath on Israel
This*p is what the Lord*s of Armies says: Glean*pn the remnant of Israel as*ln thoroughly as a vine. Pass*ln your hand once more like a grape gatherer over*ln the branches.

Who*pn can I speak to and give such a warning that*ln they will listen? Look,*ln their ear is uncircumcised, so*ln they cannot pay attention. See,*ln the word of the Lord*s has become contemptible to them — they*ln find no pleasure in it.

But*ln I am full of the Lord’s*s wrath; I*ln am tired of holding it back. Pour*ln it out on the children in the street, on*ln the gathering of young men as well. For*ln both husband and wife will be captured, the*ln old with the very old.
Their*ln houses will be turned over to others, their*ln fields and wives as well, for*ln I will stretch out my hand against*ln the inhabitants of the land. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
For*pn from the least to the greatest of them, everyone*ln is making profit dishonestly. From*ln prophet to priest, everyone*ln deals falsely.
They*ln have treated my people’s brokenness superficially, claiming,*ln “Peace, peace,” when*ln there is no peace.

Were*ln they ashamed when they acted so detestably? They*ln weren’t at all ashamed. They*ln can no longer feel humiliation. Therefore,*ln they will fall among the fallen. When*ln I punish them, they will collapse, says*ln the Lord.*s
Disaster because of Disobedience

This*p is what the Lord*s says: Stand*pn by the roadways and look. Ask*ln about the ancient paths, “Which*ln is the way to what is good?” Then*ln take it and*ln find rest for yourselves. But*ln they protested, “We won’t!”
I*ln appointed watchmen over you and*ln said, “Listen for the sound of the ram’s horn.” But*ln they protested, “We won’t listen!”
Therefore*pn listen, you nations and*ln you witnesses, learn*ln what the charge is against them.
Listen,*ln earth! I*ln am about to bring disaster on these people, the*ln fruit of their own plotting, for*ln they have paid no attention to my words. They*ln have rejected my instruction.
What*ln use to me is frankincense from Sheba or*ln sweet cane from a distant land? Your*ln burnt offerings are not acceptable; your*ln sacrifices do not please me.

Therefore,*ln this is what the Lord*s says: I*ln am going to place stumbling blocks before these people; fathers*ln and sons together will stumble over them; friends*ln and neighbors will also perish.
A Cruel Nation from the North
This*p is what the Lord*s says: Look,*pn an army is coming from a northern land; a*ln great nation will be stirred up from*ln the remote regions of the earth.

They*ln grasp bow and javelin. They*ln are cruel and show no mercy. Their*ln voice roars like the sea, and*ln they ride on horses, lined*ln up like men in battle formation against*ln you, Daughter Zion.
We*pn have heard about it, and*ln our hands have become weak. Distress*ln has seized us — pain,*ln like a woman in labor.
Don’t*ln go out to the fields; don’t*ln walk on the road. For*ln the enemy has a sword; terror*ln is on every side.
My*pn dear people, dress yourselves in sackcloth and*ln roll in the dust. Mourn*ln as you would for an only son, a*ln bitter lament, for*ln suddenly the destroyer will come on us.
Jeremiah Appointed as an Examiner
I*pn have appointed you to be an assayer among my people — a*ln refiner— so*ln you may know and assay their way of life.
All*ln are stubborn rebels spreading*ln slander. They*ln are bronze and iron; all*ln of them are corrupt.
The*ln bellows blow, blasting*ln the lead with fire. The*ln refining is completely in vain; the*ln evil ones are not separated out.
They*ln are called rejected silver, for*ln the Lord*s has rejected them.
